intro: Mimulus minor, commonly known as the small yellow monkeyflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to western North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features delicate, spurred flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and meadows. Mimulus minor is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies due to its nectar-rich flowers. It plays an important role in ecological systems by supporting biodiversity and serving as a food source for various insects.
